intro: Limnorchis tipuloides, commonly known as the marsh midge fly, is a small aquatic insect belonging to the family Chironomidae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender body and long, segmented legs adapted for life in wetland environments. The larvae of this species are often found in freshwater habitats, where they play a role in nutrient cycling. Adults are typically short-lived and are active during the summer months. This species is an important indicator of water quality in its native habitats.
